item.description:
For the benefit of the 9 to 5 club, we're going back to the Pine Hills Fire Tower. The highest point on the coast between Maine and Georgia is right here in your backyard. The climb up this 400 foot hill offers a good workout and the views are spectacular.

We won't go straight up but this hike is a little more rigorous than typically seen in Myles Standish State Forest.  Please wear good boots and bring along plenty of water and your lunch or snacks. (It's a baby hill by White Mountain standards but it's still a hill.) It takes about an hour to climb. Estimated total hike length-two and a half hours (estimating we stop for lunch for about a half an hour at the tower.) The weather is supposed to be cold this weekend so be sure you have something extra to keep you warm while we're on top.

Heavy rain or snow will cancel.
item.how_to_find_us: The hike this Sunday starts at the parking lot for the John Alden club, which is close to the intersection of Beaver Dam Road and Route 3A in Plymouth. (There should be a link for a map above.)

group.name: Friends of Myles Standish State Forest Meetup Group

item.name: Pine Hills Fire Tower
